case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial remains with soft tissues
case_address_found_1: .8 miles west of the T.J. Menach Bridge on the South side bank of the Spokane River
case_circumstances:
Body found nude along south shore of the Spokane River. Body nude. The head had been removed and was not recovered at that time. The arms were dismembered at the midpoint of both wrists as were the legs at the midcalf level. The hands and feet were never recovered. The skull was later found and matched by to this torso by DNA as well as tool markings. The skull was found on 4-19-1998 in a vacant lot loacted at 7th and Sherman Avenues in the city of Spokane Washington. Some dental information was recovered at that time. The Anthropologist has estimated the age to be between 18 and 24. There was evidence at autopsy that this woman had bore at least one child in her life time. This case is classified as a homicide. 
A single hand was discovered on 7/18/84in Spokane County. This hand has been excluded by mitochondrial DNA comparioson as a match to this case.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
